name: CIS Controls v8
description: The Center for Internet Security (CIS) Critical Security Controls v8 is a prioritized set of actions that collectively form a defense-in-depth set of best practices to mitigate the most common attacks against systems and networks. Organized into 18 control groups with safeguards mapped to three Implementation Groups (IG1, IG2, IG3) based on organizational risk profile and resources.

domains.name: Inventory and Control of Enterprise Assets
domains.description: Actively manage all enterprise assets connected to the infrastructure physically, virtually, remotely, and those within cloud environments to accurately know the totality of assets that need to be monitored and protected.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain Detailed Enterprise Asset Inventory
controls.description: Establish and maintain an accurate, detailed, and up-to-date inventory of all enterprise assets with the potential to store or process data, to include end-user devices, network devices, non-computing/IoT devices, and servers.
controls.category: Inventory and Control of Enterprise Assets

controls.title: Address Unauthorized Assets
controls.description: Ensure that a process exists to address unauthorized assets on a weekly basis. The enterprise may choose to remove the asset from the network, deny the asset from connecting remotely, or quarantine the asset.
controls.category: Inventory and Control of Enterprise Assets

controls.title: Utilize an Active Discovery Tool
controls.description: Utilize an active discovery tool to identify assets connected to the enterprise's network. Configure the active discovery tool to execute daily, or more frequently.
controls.category: Inventory and Control of Enterprise Assets

controls.title: Use Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) Logging to Update Enterprise Asset Inventory
controls.description: Use DHCP logging on all DHCP servers or Internet Protocol (IP) address management tools to update the enterprise's asset inventory. Review and use logs to update the asset inventory weekly, or more frequently.
controls.category: Inventory and Control of Enterprise Assets

controls.title: Use a Passive Asset Discovery Tool
controls.description: Use a passive discovery tool to identify assets connected to the enterprise's network. Review and use scans to update the enterprise's asset inventory at least weekly, or more frequently.
controls.category: Inventory and Control of Enterprise Assets

domains.name: Inventory and Control of Software Assets
domains.description: Actively manage all software on the network so that only authorized software is installed and can execute, and that unauthorized and unmanaged software is found and prevented from installation or execution.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Software Inventory
controls.description: Establish and maintain a detailed inventory of all licensed software installed on enterprise assets. The software inventory must document the title, publisher, initial install/use date, and business purpose for each entry.
controls.category: Inventory and Control of Software Assets

controls.title: Ensure Authorized Software is Currently Supported
controls.description: Ensure that only currently supported software is designated as authorized in the software inventory for enterprise assets. If software is unsupported yet necessary for business, document an exception.
controls.category: Inventory and Control of Software Assets

controls.title: Address Unauthorized Software
controls.description: Ensure that unauthorized software is either removed from use on enterprise assets or receives a documented exception. Review monthly, or more frequently.
controls.category: Inventory and Control of Software Assets

controls.title: Utilize Automated Software Inventory Tools
controls.description: Utilize software inventory tools, when possible, throughout the enterprise to automate the discovery and documentation of installed software.
controls.category: Inventory and Control of Software Assets

controls.title: Allowlist Authorized Software
controls.description: Use technical controls, such as application allowlisting, to ensure that only authorized software can execute or be accessed. Reassess bi-annually, or more frequently.
controls.category: Inventory and Control of Software Assets

controls.title: Allowlist Authorized Libraries
controls.description: Use technical controls to ensure that only authorized software libraries, such as specific .dll, .ocx, .so, etc., files are allowed to load into a system process.
controls.category: Inventory and Control of Software Assets

controls.title: Allowlist Authorized Scripts
controls.description: Use technical controls, such as digital signatures and version control, to ensure that only authorized scripts, such as specific .ps1, .py, etc., files are allowed to execute.
controls.category: Inventory and Control of Software Assets

domains.name: Data Protection
domains.description: Develop processes and technical controls to identify, classify, securely handle, retain, and dispose of data.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Data Management Process
controls.description: Establish and maintain a data management process. In the process, address data sensitivity, data owner, handling of data, data retention limits, and disposal requirements.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Data Inventory
controls.description: Establish and maintain a data inventory, based on the enterprise's data management process. Inventory sensitive data, at a minimum. Review and update inventory annually, or more frequently.

controls.title: Configure Data Access Control Lists
controls.description: Configure data access control lists based on a user's need to know. Apply data access control lists, also known as access permissions, to local and remote file systems, databases, and applications.

controls.title: Enforce Data Retention
controls.description: Retain data according to the enterprise's data management process. Data retention must include both minimum and maximum timelines.

controls.title: Securely Dispose of Data
controls.description: Securely dispose of data as outlined in the enterprise's data management process. Ensure the disposal process and method are commensurate with the data sensitivity.

controls.title: Encrypt Data on End-User Devices
controls.description: Encrypt data on end-user devices containing sensitive data. Example implementations can include Windows BitLocker, Apple FileVault, Linux dm-crypt.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Data Classification Scheme
controls.description: Establish and maintain an overall data classification scheme for the enterprise. Enterprises may use labels such as Sensitive, Confidential, and Public, and classify their data accordingly.

controls.title: Document Data Flows
controls.description: Document data flows. Data flow documentation includes service provider data processing, storage, and transmission locations. Review and update documentation annually, or more frequently.

controls.title: Encrypt Data on Removable Media
controls.description: Encrypt data on removable media.

controls.title: Encrypt Sensitive Data in Transit
controls.description: Encrypt sensitive data in transit. Example implementations can include Transport Layer Security (TLS) and Open Secure Shell (OpenSSH).

controls.title: Encrypt Sensitive Data at Rest
controls.description: Encrypt sensitive data at rest on servers, applications, and databases containing sensitive data. Storage-layer encryption, also known as server-side encryption, meets this safeguard requirement.

controls.title: Segment Data Processing and Storage Based on Sensitivity
controls.description: Segment data processing and storage based on the sensitivity of the data. Do not process sensitive data on enterprise assets intended for lower sensitivity data.

controls.title: Deploy a Data Loss Prevention Solution
controls.description: Implement an automated tool, such as a host-based Data Loss Prevention (DLP) tool to identify all sensitive data stored, processed, or transmitted through enterprise assets.

controls.title: Log Sensitive Data Access
controls.description: Log sensitive data access, including modification and disposal.

domains.name: Secure Configuration of Enterprise Assets and Software
domains.description: Establish and maintain the secure configuration of enterprise assets and software.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Secure Configuration Process
controls.description: Establish and maintain a secure configuration process for enterprise assets (end-user devices, including portable and mobile; network devices; non-computing/IoT devices; and servers) and software (operating systems and applications).
controls.category: Secure Configuration of Enterprise Assets and Software

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Secure Configuration Process for Network Infrastructure
controls.description: Establish and maintain a secure configuration process for network devices. Review and update documentation annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this safeguard.
controls.category: Secure Configuration of Enterprise Assets and Software

controls.title: Configure Automatic Session Locking on Enterprise Assets
controls.description: Configure automatic session locking on enterprise assets after a defined period of inactivity. For general purpose operating systems, the period must not exceed 15 minutes. For mobile end-user devices, the period must not exceed 2 minutes.
controls.category: Secure Configuration of Enterprise Assets and Software

controls.title: Implement and Manage a Firewall on Servers
controls.description: Implement and manage a firewall on servers, where supported. Example implementations include a virtual firewall, operating system firewall, or a third-party firewall agent.
controls.category: Secure Configuration of Enterprise Assets and Software

controls.title: Implement and Manage a Firewall on End-User Devices
controls.description: Implement and manage a host-based firewall or port-filtering tool on end-user devices, with a default-deny rule that drops all traffic except those services and ports that are explicitly allowed.
controls.category: Secure Configuration of Enterprise Assets and Software

controls.title: Securely Manage Enterprise Assets and Software
controls.description: Securely manage enterprise assets and software. Example implementations include managing configuration through version-controlled-infrastructure-as-code and accessing administrative interfaces over secure network protocols.
controls.category: Secure Configuration of Enterprise Assets and Software

controls.title: Manage Default Accounts on Enterprise Assets and Software
controls.description: Manage default accounts on enterprise assets and software, such as root, administrator, and other pre-configured vendor accounts. Example implementations include disabling, removing, or changing default passwords.
controls.category: Secure Configuration of Enterprise Assets and Software

controls.title: Uninstall or Disable Unnecessary Services on Enterprise Assets and Software
controls.description: Uninstall or disable unnecessary services on enterprise assets and software, such as an unused file sharing service, web application module, or service function.
controls.category: Secure Configuration of Enterprise Assets and Software

controls.title: Configure Trusted DNS Servers on Enterprise Assets
controls.description: Configure trusted DNS servers on enterprise assets. Example implementations include configuring assets to use enterprise-controlled DNS servers and/or reputable externally accessible DNS servers.
controls.category: Secure Configuration of Enterprise Assets and Software

controls.title: Enforce Automatic Device Lockout on Portable End-User Devices
controls.description: Enforce automatic device lockout following a predetermined threshold of local failed authentication attempts on portable end-user devices, where supported. For laptops, do not allow more than 20 failed authentication attempts; for tablets and smartphones, no more than 10 failed attempts.
controls.category: Secure Configuration of Enterprise Assets and Software

controls.title: Enforce Remote Wipe Capability on Portable End-User Devices
controls.description: Remotely wipe enterprise data from enterprise-owned portable end-user devices when deemed appropriate such as lost or stolen devices, or when an individual no longer supports the enterprise.
controls.category: Secure Configuration of Enterprise Assets and Software

controls.title: Separate Enterprise Workspaces on Mobile End-User Devices
controls.description: Ensure separate enterprise workspaces are used on mobile end-user devices, where supported. Example implementations include containerizing enterprise applications and data from personal applications and data through use of an MDM.
controls.category: Secure Configuration of Enterprise Assets and Software

domains.name: Account Management
domains.description: Use processes and tools to assign and manage authorization to credentials for user accounts, including administrator accounts, as well as service accounts, to enterprise assets and software.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain an Inventory of Accounts
controls.description: Establish and maintain an inventory of all accounts managed in the enterprise. The inventory must include both user and administrator accounts. The inventory, at a minimum, should contain the person's name, username, start/stop dates, and department.

controls.title: Use Unique Passwords
controls.description: Use unique passwords for all enterprise assets. Best practice implementation includes, at a minimum, an 8-character password for accounts using MFA and a 14-character password for accounts not using MFA.

controls.title: Disable Dormant Accounts
controls.description: Delete or disable any dormant accounts after a period of 45 days of inactivity, where supported.

controls.title: Restrict Administrator Privileges to Dedicated Administrator Accounts
controls.description: Restrict administrator privileges to dedicated administrator accounts on enterprise assets. Conduct general computing activities, such as internet browsing, email, and productivity suite use, from the user's primary, non-privileged account.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain an Inventory of Service Accounts
controls.description: Establish and maintain an inventory of service accounts. The inventory, at a minimum, must contain department owner, review date, and purpose. Perform service account reviews to validate that all active service accounts are authorized, on a recurring schedule at a minimum quarterly.

controls.title: Centralize Account Management
controls.description: Centralize account management through a directory or identity service.

domains.name: Access Control Management
domains.description: Use processes and tools to create, assign, manage, and revoke access credentials and privileges for user, administrator, and service accounts for enterprise assets and software.

controls.title: Establish an Access Granting Process
controls.description: Establish and follow a process, preferably automated, for granting access to enterprise assets upon new hire, rights grant, or role change of a user.

controls.title: Establish an Access Revoking Process
controls.description: Establish and follow a process, preferably automated, for revoking access to enterprise assets, through disabling accounts immediately upon termination, rights revocation, or role change of a user. Disabling accounts instead of deleting accounts may be necessary to preserve audit trails.

controls.title: Require MFA for Externally-Exposed Applications
controls.description: Require all externally-exposed enterprise or third-party applications to enforce MFA, where supported. Enforcing MFA through a directory service or SSO provider is a satisfactory implementation of this safeguard.
typical_evidence: MFA enforcement configuration for external apps

controls.title: Require MFA for Remote Network Access
controls.description: Require MFA for remote network access.
typical_evidence: MFA enrollment records for remote users

controls.title: Require MFA for Administrative Access
controls.description: Require MFA for all administrative access accounts, where supported, on all enterprise assets, whether managed on-site or through a third-party provider.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain an Inventory of Authentication and Authorization Systems
controls.description: Establish and maintain an inventory of the enterprise's authentication and authorization systems, including those hosted on-site or at a remote service provider. Review and update the inventory, at a minimum, annually.

controls.title: Centralize Access Control
controls.description: Centralize access control for all enterprise assets through a directory service or SSO provider, where supported.

controls.title: Define and Maintain Role-Based Access Control
controls.description: Define and maintain role-based access control, through determining and documenting the access rights necessary for each role within the enterprise to successfully carry out its assigned duties.

domains.name: Continuous Vulnerability Management
domains.description: Develop a plan to continuously assess and track vulnerabilities on all enterprise assets within the enterprise's infrastructure, in order to remediate and minimize the window of opportunity for attackers.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Vulnerability Management Process
controls.description: Establish and maintain a documented vulnerability management process for enterprise assets. Review and update documentation annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this safeguard.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Remediation Process
controls.description: Establish and maintain a risk-based remediation strategy documented in a remediation process, with monthly, or more frequent, parsers of those timelines.

controls.title: Perform Automated Operating System Patch Management
controls.description: Perform operating system updates on enterprise assets through automated patch management on a monthly, or more frequent, basis.

controls.title: Perform Automated Application Patch Management
controls.description: Perform application updates on enterprise assets through automated patch management on a monthly, or more frequent, basis.

controls.title: Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Internal Enterprise Assets
controls.description: Perform automated vulnerability scans of internal enterprise assets on a quarterly, or more frequent, basis. Conduct both authenticated and unauthenticated scans, using a SCAP-compliant vulnerability scanning tool.

controls.title: Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Externally-Exposed Enterprise Assets
controls.description: Perform automated vulnerability scans of externally-exposed enterprise assets using a SCAP-compliant vulnerability scanning tool. Perform scans on a monthly, or more frequent, basis.

controls.title: Remediate Detected Vulnerabilities
controls.description: Remediate detected vulnerabilities in software through processes and tooling on a monthly, or more frequent, basis, based on the remediation process.

domains.name: Audit Log Management
domains.description: Collect, alert, review, and retain audit logs of events that could help detect, understand, or recover from an attack.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain an Audit Log Management Process
controls.description: Establish and maintain an audit log management process that defines the enterprise's logging requirements. At a minimum, address the collection, review, and retention of audit logs for enterprise assets.

controls.title: Collect Audit Logs
controls.description: Collect audit logs. Ensure that logging, per the enterprise's audit log management process, has been enabled across enterprise assets.

controls.title: Ensure Adequate Audit Log Storage
controls.description: Ensure that logging destinations maintain adequate storage to comply with the enterprise's audit log management process.

controls.title: Standardize Time Synchronization
controls.description: Standardize time synchronization. Configure at least two synchronized time sources across enterprise assets, where supported.

controls.title: Collect Detailed Audit Logs
controls.description: Configure detailed audit logging for enterprise assets containing sensitive data. Include event source, date, username, timestamp, source addresses, destination addresses, and other useful elements per the enterprise's audit log management process.

controls.title: Collect DNS Query Audit Logs
controls.description: Collect DNS query audit logs on enterprise assets, where appropriate and supported.

controls.title: Collect URL Request Audit Logs
controls.description: Collect URL request audit logs on enterprise assets, where appropriate and supported.

controls.title: Collect Command-Line Audit Logs
controls.description: Collect command-line audit logs. Example implementations include collecting audit logs from PowerShell, BASH, and remote administrative terminals.

controls.title: Centralize Audit Logs
controls.description: Centralize, to the extent possible, audit log collection and retention across enterprise assets.

controls.title: Retain Audit Logs
controls.description: Retain audit logs across enterprise assets for a minimum of 90 days.

controls.title: Conduct Audit Log Reviews
controls.description: Conduct reviews of audit logs to detect anomalies or abnormal events that could indicate a potential threat. Conduct reviews on a weekly, or more frequent, basis.

controls.title: Collect Service Provider Logs
controls.description: Collect service provider logs, where supported. Example implementations include collecting authentication and authorization events, data creation and disposal events, and user management events.

domains.name: Email and Web Browser Protections
domains.description: Improve protections and detections of threats from email and web vectors, as these are opportunities for attackers to manipulate human behavior through direct engagement.

controls.title: Ensure Use of Only Fully Supported Browsers and Email Clients
controls.description: Ensure only fully supported browsers and email clients are allowed to execute in the enterprise, only using the latest version of browsers and email clients provided through the vendor.

controls.title: Use DNS Filtering Services
controls.description: Use DNS filtering services on all enterprise assets to block access to known malicious domains.

controls.title: Maintain and Enforce Network-Based URL Filters
controls.description: Enforce and update network-based URL filters to limit an enterprise asset from connecting to potentially malicious or unapproved websites. Block access to known malicious websites.

controls.title: Restrict Unnecessary or Unauthorized Browser and Email Client Extensions
controls.description: Restrict, either through uninstalling or disabling, any unauthorized or unnecessary browser or email client plugins, extensions, and add-on applications.

controls.title: Implement DMARC
controls.description: To lower the chance of spoofed or modified emails from valid domains, implement DMARC policy and verification, starting with implementing the Sender Policy Framework (SPF) and the DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) standards.

controls.title: Block Unnecessary File Types
controls.description: Block unnecessary file types attempting to enter the enterprise's email gateway.
typical_evidence: Email gateway file type blocking rules

controls.title: Deploy and Maintain Email Server Anti-Malware Protections
controls.description: Deploy and maintain email server anti-malware protections, such as attachment scanning and/or sandboxing.

domains.name: Malware Defenses
domains.description: Prevent or control the installation, spread, and execution of malicious applications, code, or scripts on enterprise assets.

controls.title: Deploy and Maintain Anti-Malware Software
controls.description: Install and maintain anti-malware software on all enterprise assets.

controls.title: Configure Automatic Anti-Malware Signature Updates
controls.description: Configure automatic updates for anti-malware signature files on all enterprise assets.

controls.title: Disable Autorun and Autoplay for Removable Media
controls.description: Disable autorun and autoplay auto-execute functionality for removable media.

controls.title: Configure Automatic Anti-Malware Scanning of Removable Media
controls.description: Configure anti-malware software to automatically scan removable media.
typical_evidence: Anti-malware scan policy for removable media

controls.title: Enable Anti-Exploitation Features
controls.description: Enable anti-exploitation features on enterprise assets and software, where possible, such as Microsoft Data Execution Prevention (DEP), Windows Defender Exploit Guard (WDEG), or Apple System Integrity Protection (SIP) and Gatekeeper.

controls.title: Centrally Manage Anti-Malware Software
controls.description: Centrally manage anti-malware software.

controls.title: Use Behavior-Based Anti-Malware Software
controls.description: Use behavior-based anti-malware software.

domains.name: Data Recovery
domains.description: Establish and maintain data recovery practices sufficient to restore in-scope enterprise assets to a pre-incident and trusted state.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Data Recovery Process
controls.description: Establish and maintain a data recovery process. In the process, address the scope of data recovery activities, recovery prioritization, and the security of backup data.

controls.title: Perform Automated Backups
controls.description: Perform automated backups of in-scope enterprise assets. Run backups weekly, or more frequently, based on the sensitivity and criticality of the enterprise asset.

controls.title: Protect Recovery Data
controls.description: Protect recovery data with equivalent controls to the original data. Reference encryption or data separation, based on requirements.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain an Isolated Instance of Recovery Data
controls.description: Establish and maintain an isolated instance of recovery data using out-of-band physical controls (i.e., not accessible through a network connection), cloud environments, or utilize a service that is natively designed for the purposes of backup data isolation.

controls.title: Test Data Recovery
controls.description: Test backup recovery quarterly, or more frequently, for a sampling of in-scope enterprise assets.

domains.name: Network Infrastructure Management
domains.description: Establish and maintain the secure configuration, monitoring, and management of network infrastructure devices.

controls.title: Ensure Network Infrastructure is Up-to-Date
controls.description: Ensure network infrastructure is kept up-to-date. Example implementations include running the latest stable release of software and/or using currently supported network-as-a-service (NaaS) offerings.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Secure Network Architecture
controls.description: Establish and maintain a secure network architecture. A secure network architecture must address segmentation, least privilege, and availability, at a minimum.

controls.title: Securely Manage Network Infrastructure
controls.description: Securely manage network infrastructure. Example implementations include version-controlled-infrastructure-as-code, and the use of secure network protocols, such as SSH and HTTPS.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain Architecture Diagram(s)
controls.description: Establish and maintain architecture diagram(s) and/or other network system documentation. Review and update documentation annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this safeguard.

controls.title: Centralize Network Authentication, Authorization, and Auditing (AAA)
controls.description: Centralize network AAA.

controls.title: Use of Secure Network Management and Communication Protocols
controls.description: Use secure network management and communication protocols (e.g., 802.1X, Wi-Fi Protected Access 2 (WPA2) Enterprise or greater).

controls.title: Ensure Remote Devices Utilize a VPN and are Connecting to an Enterprise's AAA Infrastructure
controls.description: Require users to authenticate to enterprise-managed VPN and authentication infrastructure prior to accessing enterprise resources on end-user devices.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain Dedicated Computing Resources for All Administrative Work
controls.description: Establish and maintain dedicated computing resources, either physically or logically separated, for all administrative tasks or tasks requiring elevated access. The computing resources should be segmented from the enterprise's primary network and not be allowed internet access.

domains.name: Network Monitoring and Defense
domains.description: Operate processes and tooling to establish and maintain comprehensive network monitoring and defense against security threats across the enterprise's network infrastructure and user base.

controls.title: Centralize Security Event Alerting
controls.description: Centralize security event alerting across enterprise assets for log correlation and analysis. Best practice implementation requires the use of a SIEM, which includes vendor-defined event correlation alerts.

controls.title: Deploy a Host-Based Intrusion Detection Solution
controls.description: Deploy a host-based intrusion detection solution on enterprise assets, where appropriate and/or supported.

controls.title: Deploy a Network Intrusion Detection Solution
controls.description: Deploy a network intrusion detection solution on enterprise assets, where appropriate. Example implementations include the use of a Network Intrusion Detection System (NIDS) or equivalent cloud service provider (CSP) service.

controls.title: Perform Traffic Filtering Between Network Segments
controls.description: Perform traffic filtering between network segments, where appropriate.

controls.title: Manage Access Control for Remote Assets
controls.description: Manage access control for assets remotely connecting to enterprise resources. Determine amount of access to enterprise resources based on up-to-date anti-malware software installed, configuration compliance with the enterprise's secure configuration process, and ensuring the operating system and applications are up-to-date.
typical_evidence: Health check policy for remote connections

controls.title: Collect Network Traffic Flow Logs
controls.description: Collect network traffic flow logs and/or network traffic to review and alert upon from network devices.

controls.title: Deploy a Host-Based Intrusion Prevention Solution
controls.description: Deploy a host-based intrusion prevention solution on enterprise assets, where appropriate and/or supported. Example implementations include use of an Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) client or host-based IPS agent.

controls.title: Deploy a Network Intrusion Prevention Solution
controls.description: Deploy a network intrusion prevention solution, where appropriate. Example implementations include the use of a Network Intrusion Prevention System (NIPS) or equivalent CSP service.

controls.title: Deploy Port-Level Access Control
controls.description: Deploy port-level access control. Port-level access control utilizes 802.1x, or similar network access control (NAC) protocols, such as certificates, and may incorporate user and/or device authentication.

controls.title: Perform Application Layer Filtering
controls.description: Perform application layer filtering. Example implementations include a filtering proxy, application layer firewall, or gateway.

controls.title: Tune Security Event Alerting Thresholds
controls.description: Tune security event alerting thresholds monthly, or more frequently.

domains.name: Security Awareness and Skills Training
domains.description: Establish and maintain a security awareness program to influence behavior among the workforce to be security conscious and properly skilled to reduce cybersecurity risks to the enterprise.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Security Awareness Program
controls.description: Establish and maintain a security awareness program. The purpose of a security awareness program is to educate the enterprise's workforce on how to interact with enterprise assets and data in a secure manner.

controls.title: Train Workforce Members to Recognize Social Engineering Attacks
controls.description: Train workforce members to recognize social engineering attacks, such as phishing, pre-texting, and tailgating.

controls.title: Train Workforce Members on Authentication Best Practices
controls.description: Train workforce members on authentication best practices. Example topics include MFA, password composition, and credential management.

controls.title: Train Workforce Members on Data Handling Best Practices
controls.description: Train workforce members on how to identify and properly store, transfer, archive, and destroy sensitive data. This also includes training workforce members on clear screen and clear desk best practices.

controls.title: Train Workforce Members on Causes of Unintentional Data Exposure
controls.description: Train workforce members to be aware of causes for unintentional data exposure. Example topics include mis-delivery of sensitive data, losing a portable end-user device, or publishing data to unintended audiences.

controls.title: Train Workforce Members on Recognizing and Reporting Security Incidents
controls.description: Train workforce members to be able to recognize a potential incident and be able to report such an incident.

controls.title: Train Workforce on How to Identify and Report if Their Enterprise Assets are Missing Security Updates
controls.description: Train workforce to understand how to verify and report out-of-date software patches or any failures in automated processes and tools. Part of this training should include notifying IT personnel of any failures in automated processes and tools.

controls.title: Train Workforce on the Dangers of Connecting to and Transmitting Enterprise Data Over Insecure Networks
controls.description: Train workforce members on the dangers of connecting to, and transmitting data over, insecure networks for enterprise activities. If the enterprise has remote workers, training must include guidance to ensure that all users securely configure their home network infrastructure.

controls.title: Conduct Role-Specific Security Awareness and Skills Training
controls.description: Conduct role-specific security awareness and skills training. Example implementations include secure system administration courses for IT professionals, OWASP Top 10 vulnerability awareness and prevention training for web application developers, and advanced social engineering awareness training for high-profile roles.

domains.name: Service Provider Management
domains.description: Develop a process to evaluate service providers who hold sensitive data, or are responsible for an enterprise's critical IT platforms or processes, to ensure these providers are protecting those platforms and data appropriately.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain an Inventory of Service Providers
controls.description: Establish and maintain an inventory of service providers. The inventory is to list all known service providers, include classification(s), and designate an enterprise contact for each service provider.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Service Provider Management Policy
controls.description: Establish and maintain a service provider management policy. Ensure the policy addresses the classification, inventory, assessment, monitoring, and decommissioning of service providers.

controls.title: Classify Service Providers
controls.description: Classify service providers. Classification consideration may include one or more characteristics, such as data sensitivity, data volume, availability requirements, applicable regulations, inherent risk, and mitigated risk.

controls.title: Ensure Service Provider Contracts Include Security Requirements
controls.description: Ensure service provider contracts include security requirements. Example requirements may include minimum security program requirements, security incident and/or data breach notification and response, data encryption requirements, and data disposal commitments.
typical_evidence: Service provider contract templates with security clauses

controls.title: Assess Service Providers
controls.description: Assess service providers consistent with the enterprise's service provider management policy. Assessment scope may vary based on classification(s), and may include review of standardized assessment reports (e.g., SOC 2, PCI DSS Attestation of Compliance), questionnaires, or other appropriately rigorous processes.

controls.title: Monitor Service Providers
controls.description: Monitor service providers consistent with the enterprise's service provider management policy. Monitoring may include periodic reassessment of service provider compliance, monitoring service provider release notes, and dark web monitoring.

controls.title: Securely Decommission Service Providers
controls.description: Securely decommission service providers. Example considerations include user and service account deactivation, termination of data flows, and secure disposal of enterprise data within the service provider environment.
typical_evidence: Access revocation records for decommissioned providers

domains.name: Application Software Security
domains.description: Manage the security life cycle of in-house developed, hosted, or acquired software to prevent, detect, and remediate security weaknesses before they can impact the enterprise.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Secure Application Development Process
controls.description: Establish and maintain a secure application development process. In the process, address such items as secure application design standards, secure coding practices, developer training, vulnerability management, security of third-party code, and application security testing procedures.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Process to Accept and Address Software Vulnerabilities
controls.description: Establish and maintain a process to accept and address reports of software vulnerabilities, including providing a means for external entities to report. The process is to include such items as a vulnerability handling policy that addresses reporting, triaging, and remediating discovered vulnerabilities.

controls.title: Perform Root Cause Analysis on Security Vulnerabilities
controls.description: Perform root cause analysis on security vulnerabilities. When reviewing vulnerabilities, root cause analysis is the task of evaluating underlying issues that create vulnerabilities in code, and allows development teams to move beyond just fixing individual vulnerabilities as they arise.

controls.title: Establish and Manage an Inventory of Third-Party Software Components
controls.description: Establish and manage an updated inventory of third-party components used in development, often referred to as a bill of materials, as well as components planned for future use.

controls.title: Use Up-to-Date and Trusted Third-Party Software Components
controls.description: Use up-to-date and trusted third-party software components. When possible, choose established and proven frameworks and libraries that provide adequate security. Acquire these components from trusted sources or evaluate the software for vulnerabilities before use.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Severity Rating System and Process for Application Vulnerabilities
controls.description: Establish and maintain a severity rating system and process for application vulnerabilities that facilitates prioritizing the order in which discovered vulnerabilities are fixed. This process includes setting a minimum level of security acceptability for releasing code or applications.

controls.title: Use Standard Hardening Configuration Templates for Application Infrastructure
controls.description: Use standard, industry-recommended hardening configuration templates for application infrastructure components. This includes underlying servers, databases, and web servers, and applies to cloud containers, Platform as a Service (PaaS) components, and SaaS components.

controls.title: Separate Production and Non-Production Systems
controls.description: Maintain separate environments for production and non-production systems. Developers should not have unmonitored access to production environments.

controls.title: Train Developers in Application Security Concepts and Secure Coding
controls.description: Ensure that all software development personnel receive training in writing secure code for their specific development environment and responsibilities. Training can include general security principles and application security standard practices.

controls.title: Apply Secure Design Principles in Application Architectures
controls.description: Apply secure design principles in application architectures. Secure design principles include the concept of least privilege and enforcing mediation to validate every operation that the user makes, promoting the concept of fail securely.

controls.title: Leverage Vetted Modules or Services for Application Security Components
controls.description: Leverage vetted modules or services for application security components, such as identity management, encryption, and auditing and logging. Using platform features in critical security functions will reduce developers' workload and minimize the likelihood of design or implementation errors.

controls.title: Implement Code-Level Security Checks
controls.description: Apply static and dynamic analysis tools within the application life cycle to verify that secure coding practices are being followed.

controls.title: Conduct Application Penetration Testing
controls.description: Conduct application penetration testing. For critical applications, authenticated penetration testing is better suited to finding business logic vulnerabilities than code scanning and automated security testing.

controls.title: Conduct Threat Modeling
controls.description: Conduct threat modeling. Threat modeling is the process of identifying and addressing application security design flaws within a design, before code is created. It is conducted through specially trained individuals who evaluate the application design and gauge security risks for each entry point and access level.

domains.name: Incident Response Management
domains.description: Establish a program to develop and maintain an incident response capability (e.g., policies, plans, procedures, defined roles, training, and communications) to prepare, detect, and quickly respond to an attack.

controls.title: Designate Personnel to Manage Incident Handling
controls.description: Designate one key person, and at least one backup, who will manage the enterprise's incident handling process. Management personnel are responsible for the coordination and documentation of incident response and recovery efforts.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain Contact Information for Reporting Security Incidents
controls.description: Establish and maintain contact information for parties that need to be informed of security incidents. Contacts may include internal staff, third-party vendors, law enforcement, cyber insurance providers, relevant government agencies, Information Sharing and Analysis Center (ISAC) partners, or other stakeholders.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain an Enterprise Process for Reporting Incidents
controls.description: Establish and maintain an enterprise process for the workforce to report security incidents. The process includes reporting timeframe, personnel to report to, mechanism for reporting, and the minimum information to be reported. Ensure the process is publicly available to all of the workforce.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain an Incident Response Process
controls.description: Establish and maintain an incident response process that addresses roles and responsibilities, compliance requirements, and a communication plan. Review annually, or when significant enterprise changes occur that could impact this safeguard.

controls.title: Assign Key Roles and Responsibilities
controls.description: Assign key roles and responsibilities for incident response, including staff from legal, IT, information security, facilities, public relations, human resources, incident responders, and analysts, as applicable.

controls.title: Define Mechanisms for Communicating During Incident Response
controls.description: Define and document mechanisms for communicating during incident response that include both internal and external communications. Mechanisms can include phone calls, emails, or letters. Mechanisms should include the appropriate steps to ensure that communication messaging is confidential and protected.

controls.title: Conduct Routine Incident Response Exercises
controls.description: Plan and conduct routine incident response exercises and scenarios for key personnel involved in the incident response process to prepare for responding to real-world incidents. Exercises need to test communication channels, decision making, and workflows.

controls.title: Conduct Post-Incident Reviews
controls.description: Conduct post-incident reviews. Post-incident reviews help prevent incident recurrence through identifying lessons learned and follow-up action.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain Security Incident Thresholds
controls.description: Establish and maintain security incident thresholds, including, at a minimum, differentiating between an incident and an event.

domains.name: Penetration Testing
domains.description: Test the effectiveness and resiliency of enterprise assets through identifying and exploiting weaknesses in controls (people, processes, and technology), and simulating the objectives and actions of an attacker.

controls.title: Establish and Maintain a Penetration Testing Program
controls.description: Establish and maintain a penetration testing program appropriate to the size, complexity, and maturity of the enterprise. Penetration testing program characteristics include scope, such as network, web application, Application Programming Interface (API), hosted services, and physical premise controls.

controls.title: Perform Periodic External Penetration Tests
controls.description: Perform periodic external penetration tests based on program requirements, no less than annually. External penetration testing must include enterprise and environmental reconnaissance to detect exploitable information.

controls.title: Remediate Penetration Test Findings
controls.description: Remediate penetration test findings based on the enterprise's policy for remediation scope and prioritization.

controls.title: Validate Security Measures
controls.description: Validate security measures after each penetration test. If deemed necessary, modify rulesets and capabilities to detect the techniques used during testing.
typical_evidence: Detection rule updates based on pentest

controls.title: Perform Periodic Internal Penetration Tests
controls.description: Perform periodic internal penetration tests based on program requirements, no less than annually. The testing may be clear box or opaque box.
